thread.title: Ground News - A Weathered Celebration: Augusta’s New Year’s Eve Climate
thread.title_full: Ground News - A Weathered Celebration: Augusta’s New Year’s Eve Climate

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - A Weathered Celebration: Augusta’s New Year’s Eve Climate
text:
Summary by Ground News The average high temperature for the day is 58 degrees. Augusta has seen some extreme temperatures on New Year's Eve, both high and low. The warmest one was in 1984, when the mercury soared to 80 degrees. The wettestOne was in 1981, when we got a whopping 2.36 inches of rain. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
WJBF Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Nexstar Media Group A Weathered Celebration: Augusta’s New Year’s Eve Climate Hey, are you ready to say goodbye to 2023 and hello to 2024? I know I am! But before we pop the champagne and watch the fireworks, let’s talk about the weather. How will it affect our New Year’s Eve plans in Augusta? Well, I did some digging and found out some interesting facts about the climate history and the forecast for this year. Average Highs and Overall Trends You might think that New Year’s Eve is always chilly in Augusta, but that’s not…
